      • useDebugMode

        public void useDebugMode()

      • calulateEuclideanGivenScale

        public TransformationParameters calulateEuclideanGivenScale(double scale,
                                                            algorithms.util.PairIntArray matchedXY1,
                                                            algorithms.util.PairIntArray matchedXY2,
                                                            double centroidX1,
                                                            double centroidY1)
        coordinate transformations from image 1 to image 2 are calculated from matching lists of x, y coordinates, and given "scale" as a starting parameter. Scale is determined roughly from the contour matcher, so can be used to get a rough first solution. Note, the rotation, when applied, will result in a clockwise direction (which is in the -z direction using right hand rule). 
         positive Y is up
       positive X is right
       positive theta starts from Y=0, X>=0 and proceeds CW
             +Y 270
                 |
                 |
          180--------- 0   +X
                 |
                 |
                 90
                 -Y
        Parameters:
        scale -
        matchedXY1 -
        matchedXY2 -
        centroidX1 -
        centroidY1 -
        Returns:

                                                  double centroidX1,
                                                  double centroidY1)
        coordinate transformations from pair 1 to pair 2 are calculated. positive Y is up positive X is right positive theta starts from Y=0, X>=0 and proceeds CW 270 | | 180--------- 0 +X | | 90 -Y
        Parameters:
        centroidX1 -
        centroidY1 -
        Returns:

      • calulateEuclidean

        public TransformationParameters calulateEuclidean(algorithms.util.PairIntArray matchedXY1,
                                                  algorithms.util.PairIntArray matchedXY2,
                                                  float[] weights,
                                                  double centroidX1,
                                                  double centroidY1,
                                                  float[] outputScaleRotTransXYStDev)
        coordinate transformations from pair 1 to pair 2 are calculated from the widest pairings of the given matched points. positive Y is up positive X is right positive theta starts from Y=0, X>=0 and proceeds CW 270 | | 180--------- 0 +X | | 90 -Y
        Parameters:
        matchedXY1 -
        matchedXY2 -
        weights -
        centroidX1 -
        centroidY1 -
        outputScaleRotTransXYStDev - output standard deviation of the scale, rotation, and translations in X and Y. If null, calculations are not performed for standard deviation from mean.
        Returns:

      • calulateEuclidean

        public TransformationParameters calulateEuclidean(algorithms.util.PairIntArray matchedXY1,
                                                  algorithms.util.PairIntArray matchedXY2,
                                                  float[] weights,
                                                  double centroidX1,
                                                  double centroidY1,
                                                  float[] outputScaleRotTransXYStDev,
                                                  gnu.trove.list.TIntList outputInlierIndexes)
        coordinate transformations from pair 1 to pair 2 are calculated from the widest pairings of the given matched points. positive Y is up positive X is right positive theta starts from Y=0, X>=0 and proceeds CW 270 | | 180--------- 0 +X | | 90 -Y

        matchedXY2 -
        weights -
        centroidX1 -
        centroidY1 -
        outputScaleRotTransXYStDev - output standard deviation of the scale, rotation, and translations in X and Y. If null, calculations are not performed for standard deviation from mean.
        Returns:

      • calulateEuclideanWithoutFilter

        public TransformationParameters calulateEuclideanWithoutFilter(algorithms.util.PairIntArray matchedXY1,
                                                               algorithms.util.PairIntArray matchedXY2,
                                                               double centroidX1,
                                                               double centroidY1)
        coordinate transformations from pair 1 to pair 2 are calculated from the widest pairings of the given matched points. No standard deviations from mean values are calculated and no filtering is performed. The method is meant to be used with code which will use other methods to filter the points. positive Y is up positive X is right positive theta starts from Y=0, X>=0 and proceeds CW 270 | | 180--------- 0 +X | | 90 -Y
        Parameters:
        matchedXY1 -
        matchedXY2 -
        centroidX1 -
        centroidY1 -
        Returns:

      • swapReferenceFrames

        public TransformationParameters swapReferenceFrames(TransformationParameters params)
        from a set of transformation parameters params that transform points in reference frame 1 into reference frame 2, create a transformation that can transform points in reference frame 2 into reference frame 1.
        Parameters:
        params - transformation parameters to apply to points in reference frame 1 to put them in reference frame 2
        Returns:
        transformation parameters that can transform points in reference frame 2 into reference frame 1

      • averageWithoutRemoval

        public TransformationParameters averageWithoutRemoval(java.util.List<TransformationParameters> paramsList)
        average the paramsList without using outlier removal. Note, the standard deviations are not recalculated (later, if that's useful, they should be added in quadrature here and set in the result). NOTE that if the origins are not zero, this method cannot be used
        Parameters:
        paramsList -
        Returns:
